intro: Memecylon brenanii, commonly known as the Bornean memecylon, is a species of flowering plant in the family Melastomataceae. It is native to the rainforests of Borneo, where it thrives in humid, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its small, opposite leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows as an understory shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species in its native range.
